import Mathlib

/--
Let $X$ be a finite set with at least $10$ elements; for each $i \in \{0, 1, ..., 1065\}$, let $A_i \subseteq X$ satisfy $|A_i| > \frac{1}{2}|X|$. Prove that there exist $10$ elements $x_1, x_2, \dots, x_{10} \in X$ such that each $A_i$ contains at least one of $x_1, x_2, \dots, x_{10}$.
-/

{T : Type}
(X : Finset T)
(A : Fin 1066 → Finset T)
(hX : X.card ≥ 10)
(hA : ∀ i : Fin 1066, A i ⊆ X ∧ (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ)/2) * X.card)
: ∃ Y : Finset T, Y ⊆ X ∧ Y.card = 10 ∧ ∀ i : Fin 1066, ∃ y ∈ Y, y ∈ A i :=

theorem putnam_1980_b4
{T : Type}
(X : Finset T)
(A : Fin 1066 → Finset T)
(hX : X.card ≥ 10)
(hA : ∀ i : Fin 1066, A i ⊆ X ∧ (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ)/2) * X.card)
: ∃ Y : Finset T, Y ⊆ X ∧ Y.card = 10 ∧ ∀ i : Fin 1066, ∃ y ∈ Y, y ∈ A i := by
  have hX' : X.card ≥ 10 := hX
  have hA' : ∀ i : Fin 1066, A i ⊆ X ∧ (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ)/2) * X.card := hA
  -- Use the fact that the average size of each A_i is more than half the size of X
  -- to show that there must be at least 10 elements in X that are common to at least one A_i.
  classical
  -- Use the fact that the average size of each A_i is more than half the size of X
  -- to show that there must be at least 10 elements in X that are common to at least one A_i.
  obtain ⟨Y, hY⟩ := Finset.exists_smaller_set X 10 (by linarith)
  use Y
  constructor
  -- Show that Y is a subset of X
  <;> simp_all [Finset.card_mono]
  <;> norm_num
  <;> linarith [hA' 0, hA' 1, hA' 2, hA' 3, hA' 4, hA' 5, hA' 6, hA' 7, hA' 8, hA' 9, hA' 10]
  <;> aesop
```

```lean4
import Mathlib

/--
Let $X$ be a finite set with at least $10$ elements; for each $i \in \{0, 1, ..., 1065\}$, let $A_i \subseteq X$ satisfy $|A_i| > \frac{1}{2}|X|$. Prove that there exist $10$ elements $x_1, x_2, \dots, x_{10} \in X$ such that each $A_i$ contains at least one of $x_1, x_2, \dots, x_{10}$.
-/
theorem putnam_1980_b4
{T : Type}
(X : Finset T)
(A : Fin 1066 → Finset T)
(hX : X.card ≥ 10)
(hA : ∀ i : Fin 1066, A i ⊆ X ∧ (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ)/2) * X.card)
: ∃ Y : Finset T, Y ⊆ X ∧ Y.card = 10 ∧ ∀ i : Fin 1066, ∃ y ∈ Y, y ∈ A i :=

```lean4
theorem putnam_1980_b4
{T : Type}
(X : Finset T)
(A : Fin 1066 → Finset T)
(hX : X.card ≥ 10)
(hA : ∀ i : Fin 1066, A i ⊆ X ∧ (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ)/2) * X.card)
: ∃ Y : Finset T, Y ⊆ X ∧ Y.card = 10 ∧ ∀ i : Fin 1066, ∃ y ∈ Y, y ∈ A i := by
  classical
  have h₁ : ∃ Y : Finset T, Y ⊆ X ∧ Y.card = 10 ∧ ∀ i : Fin 1066, ∃ y ∈ Y, y ∈ A i := by
    -- Use the fact that the average size of each A_i is more than half the size of X
    -- to find a subset Y of X with exactly 10 elements that satisfies the condition.
    obtain ⟨Y, hY⟩ := Finset.exists_smaller_set X 10 (by
      norm_num
      linarith [hX])
    refine' ⟨Y, hY.1, hY.2, _⟩
    intro i
    have h := hA i
    have h₂ : A i ⊆ X := h.1
    have h₃ : (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ) / 2) * X.card := h.2
    have h₄ : (A i ∩ Y).card > 0 := by
      have h₅ : (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ) / 2) * X.card := h₃
      have h₆ : (A i ∩ Y).card ≤ (A i).card := by
        apply Finset.card_mono
        apply Finset.inter_subset_left
      have h₇ : (A i ∩ Y).card > ((1 : ℚ) / 2) * X.card := by
        have h₈ : ((1 : ℚ) / 2) * X.card < (A i).card := by
          norm_num at h₅ ⊢
          nlinarith
        have h₉ : (A i ∩ Y).card ≤ (A i).card := by
          apply Finset.card_mono
          apply Finset.inter_subset_left
        have h₁₀ : ((1 : ℚ) / 2) * X.card < (A i).card := by
          norm_num at h₈ ⊢
          nlinarith
        have h₁₁ : ((1 : ℚ) / 2) * X.card < (A i).card := by
          norm_num at h₈ ⊢
          nlinarith
        nlinarith
      linarith
    obtain ⟨y, hy⟩ := Finset.card_pos.mp h₄
    exact ⟨y, by aesop⟩
  exact h₁
```

import Mathlib

/--

-/
theorem putnam_1980_b4
{T : Type}
(X : Finset T)
(A : Fin 1066 → Finset T)
(hX : X.card ≥ 10)
(hA : ∀ i : Fin 1066, A i ⊆ X ∧ (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ)/2) * X.card)
: ∃ Y : Finset T, Y ⊆ X ∧ Y.card = 10 ∧ ∀ i : Fin 1066, ∃ y ∈ Y, y ∈ A i :=

```lean4
theorem putnam_1980_b4
{T : Type}
(X : Finset T)
(A : Fin 1066 → Finset T)
(hX : X.card ≥ 10)
(hA : ∀ i : Fin 1066, A i ⊆ X ∧ (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ)/2) * X.card)
: ∃ Y : Finset T, Y ⊆ X ∧ Y.card = 10 ∧ ∀ i : Fin 1066, ∃ y ∈ Y, y ∈ A i := by
  classical
  -- We will construct a subset Y of X with exactly 10 elements and show that each A_i intersects Y non-empty.
  have h₁ := hA 0
  have h₂ := hA 1
  have h₃ := hA 2
  have h₄ := hA 3
  have h₅ := hA 4
  have h₆ := hA 5
  have h₇ := hA 6
  have h₈ := hA 7
  have h₉ := hA 8
  have h₁₀ := hA 9
  -- Use the fact that each A_i has more than half the elements of X to find a subset Y with 10 elements that intersects each A_i.
  obtain ⟨Y, hY⟩ := Finset.exists_smaller_set X 10 (by linarith)
  use Y
  constructor
  -- Show that Y is a subset of X.
  <;> simp_all [Finset.subset_iff]
  <;> norm_num
  <;> aesop
```

theorem putnam_1980_b4
{T : Type}
(X : Finset T)
(A : Fin 1066 → Finset T)
(hX : X.card ≥ 10)
(hA : ∀ i : Fin 1066, A i ⊆ X ∧ (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ)/2) * X.card)
: ∃ Y : Finset T, Y ⊆ X ∧ Y.card = 10 ∧ ∀ i : Fin 1066, ∃ y ∈ Y, y ∈ A i := by
  classical
  -- We will construct the set Y by selecting 10 elements from X that satisfy the required conditions.
  rw [ge_iff_le] at hX
  obtain ⟨Y, hY⟩ := Finset.exists_smaller_set X 10 (by linarith)
  use Y
  constructor
  -- Show that Y is a subset of X.
  <;> simp_all [Finset.card_mono]
  <;> norm_num
  <;> rcases hA 0 with ⟨hA0, hA0'⟩

theorem putnam_1980_b4
{T : Type}
(X : Finset T)
(A : Fin 1066 → Finset T)
(hX : X.card ≥ 10)
(hA : ∀ i : Fin 1066, A i ⊆ X ∧ (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ)/2) * X.card)
: ∃ Y : Finset T, Y ⊆ X ∧ Y.card = 10 ∧ ∀ i : Fin 1066, ∃ y ∈ Y, y ∈ A i := by
  have hX' : X.card ≥ 10 := hX
  have hA' : ∀ i : Fin 1066, A i ⊆ X ∧ (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ) / 2) * X.card := hA

  -- to show that there must be at least 10 elements in X that are in at least one A_i.
  classical
  -- Use the pidgeonhole principle to find a subset Y of X with 10 elements that satisfies the conditions.
  obtain ⟨Y, hY⟩ := Finset.exists_smaller_set X 10 (by linarith)
  use Y
  -- Verify that Y satisfies the conditions.
  constructor
  -- Y is a subset of X.
  <;> simp_all [Finset.subset_iff]
  <;> norm_num
  <;> aesop

import Mathlib

/--
Let $X$ be a finite set with at least $10$ elements; for each $i \in \{0, 1, ..., 1065\}$, let $A_i \subseteq X$ satisfy $|A_i| > \frac{1}{2}|X|$. Prove that there exist $10$ elements $x_1, x_2, \dots, x_{10} \in X$ such that each $A_i$ contains at least one of $x_1, x_2, \dots, x_{10}$.
-/
theorem putnam_1980_b4
{T : Type}
(X : Finset T)
(A : Fin 1066 → Finset T)
(hX : X.card ≥ 10)
(hA : ∀ i : Fin 1066, A i ⊆ X ∧ (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ)/2) * X.card)
: ∃ Y : Finset T, Y ⊆ X ∧ Y.card = 10 ∧ ∀ i : Fin 1066, ∃ y ∈ Y, y ∈ A i :=

```lean4
theorem putnam_1980_b4
{T : Type}
(X : Finset T)
(A : Fin 1066 → Finset T)
(hX : X.card ≥ 10)
(hA : ∀ i : Fin 1066, A i ⊆ X ∧ (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ)/2) * X.card)
: ∃ Y : Finset T, Y ⊆ X ∧ Y.card = 10 ∧ ∀ i : Fin 1066, ∃ y ∈ Y, y ∈ A i := by
  have hX' : X.card ≥ 10 := hX
  have hA' : ∀ i : Fin 1066, A i ⊆ X ∧ (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ) / 2) * X.card := hA
  -- Use the fact that the average of the sizes of the A_i's is greater than half the size of X
  -- to show that there must be at least 10 elements in X that are common to at least one A_i.
  obtain ⟨Y, hY⟩ := Finset.exists_smaller_set X 10 (by linarith)
  use Y
  constructor
  -- Show that Y is a subset of X.
  <;> simp_all [Finset.card_mono]
  <;> norm_num
  <;> linarith [hA' 0, hA' 1, hA' 2, hA' 3, hA' 4, hA' 5, hA' 6, hA' 7, hA' 8, hA' 9, hA' 10]
  <;> aesop
```

Complete the following Lean 4 code:
```lean4
import Mathlib

/--
Let $X$ be a finite set with at least $10$ elements; for each $i \in \{0, 1, ..., 1065\}$, let $A_i \subseteq X$ satisfy $|A_i| > \frac{1}{2}|X|$. Prove that there exist $10$ elements $x_1, x_2, \dots, x_{10} \in X$ such that each $A_i$ contains at least one of $x_1, x_2, \dots, x_{10}$.
-/
theorem putnam_1980_b4
{T : Type}
(X : Finset T)
(A : Fin 1066 → Finset T)
(hX : X.card ≥ 10)
(hA : ∀ i : Fin 1066, A i ⊆ X ∧ (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ)/2) * X.card)
: ∃ Y : Finset T, Y ⊆ X ∧ Y.card = 10 ∧ ∀ i : Fin 1066, ∃ y ∈ Y, y ∈ A i :=

```lean4
theorem putnam_1980_b4
{T : Type}
(X : Finset T)
(A : Fin 1066 → Finset T)
(hX : X.card ≥ 10)
(hA : ∀ i : Fin 1066, A i ⊆ X ∧ (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ)/2) * X.card)
: ∃ Y : Finset T, Y ⊆ X ∧ Y.card = 10 ∧ ∀ i : Fin 1066, ∃ y ∈ Y, y ∈ A i := by
  have hX' : X.card ≥ 10 := hX
  have hA' : ∀ i : Fin 1066, A i ⊆ X ∧ (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ) / 2) * X.card := hA
  -- Use the fact that the average of the sizes of the A_i's is greater than half the size of X
  -- to show that there must be a set Y of 10 elements that intersects each A_i.
  obtain ⟨Y, hY, hY_card⟩ := Finset.exists_smaller_set X 10 (by linarith)
  use Y
  constructor
  · -- Show that Y is a subset of X
    exact hY
  constructor
  · -- Show that the cardinality of Y is 10
    exact hY_card
  · -- Show that for each i, there exists an element in Y that is in A_i
    intro i
    have hAi := hA' i
    have hAi_sub : A i ⊆ X := hAi.1
    have hAi_card : (A i).card > ((1 : ℚ) / 2) * X.card := hAi.2
    have hY_inter : ∃ y ∈ Y, y ∈ A i := by
      -- Use the fact that the size of A_i is greater than half the size of X
      -- and the size of Y is 10 to show that Y must intersect A_i.
      have hY_inter : Y.Nonempty := Finset.card_pos.1 (by linarith : 0 < Y.card)
      obtain ⟨y, hy⟩ := hY_inter
      have hY_inter' : y ∈ X := hY hy
      have hA_i_inter : y ∈ A i := by
        have hA_i_sub : A i ⊆ X := hAi_sub
        exact hA_i_sub (by aesop)
      exact ⟨y, hy, hA_i_inter⟩
    exact hY_inter
```
